abstracts.cdata!:
The overall objective of the Emergency
            Support to Enhance Food Security (ESEFS) Project of Benin is
            to assist producers to increase domestic food production in
            the short term. Specifically, these include: 1) stockpile
            family, community and buffer consumer food products to put
            on the market during the lean season to alleviate the
            pressure on prices; 2) produce in the short-term adequate
            amounts of food in order to stifle or at least mitigate the
            perverse impact of this crisis on the quality of life of
            both urban and rural populations; 3) develop more in the
            long term by having a strategic reserve of food security in
            particular with respect to rice and corn. Negative
            biophysical impacts include: Loss of aquatic habitats; Loss
            of area of terrestrial vegetation and wildlife habitat;
            Deteriorating quality of water resources (surface and
            groundwater) due to residue of pesticides and other
            synthetic chemical pollutants; Decimation of non-target
            organisms (auxiliary) by pesticides and other harmful
            explosion of cultures; Degrading of land through
            salinization, alkalinization and acidification; Poisoning of
            the food chain through bioaccumulation in particular in
            areas where irrigation and pesticide use have been combined;
            Exhaustion of potential groundwater resources by excessive
            pumping for agriculture; Contamination of crops by
            agricultural mismanagement of input storage in stores;
            Pollution of soil and waters by oil spills and chemical
            inputs to synthesis. Negative health impacts include:
            Mortality due to acute food poisoning linked to the
            mismanagement of pesticides packaging or processing of grain
            by pesticides; Increased prevalence of food-borne diseases
            related to water ; Contamination of livestock due to
            degradation of water quality of reservoirs; Increased cases
            of conflicts between herders and farmers with the
            development of agricultural areas; Land insecurity.
